treatment.reference: The marine cyanobacterium Synechococcus sp. WH7805 requires urease (urea amidohydrolase, EC 3.5.1.5) to utilize urea as a nitrogen source: molecular-genetic and biochemical analysis of the enzyme (Collier, J., et al., 1999)
treatment.description: unicellular marine cyanobacterium, The marine cyanobacterium Synechococcus sp. WH7805 requires urease (urea amidohydrolase, EC 3.5.1.5) to utilize urea as a nitrogen source. Urea, ammonium and nitrate could each be utilized as the sole nitrogen source supporting growth of Synechococcus WH7805. WH7805 also possesses a high-affinity urea-transport system.
